title: Travel & Airport Vocabulary
description: Navigate the world of airport and air travel terminology like a seasoned traveler

questions.question: At an airport, what is a 'layover'?
options: A flight that goes the wrong way
A scheduled stop between connecting flights where passengers wait at an intermediate airport

questions.question: In air travel, what does 'boarding pass' refer to?
options: A document that grants a passenger permission to board a specific flight with seat and gate information
A pass to board a bus
A ticket to buy a plane

questions.question: What is a 'red-eye flight'?
options: A late-night flight that departs at night and arrives early morning, often causing fatigue

questions.question: In airport terminology, what is 'customs'?
options: A government checkpoint where travelers' goods are inspected and duties may be collected on imports

questions.question: What does 'carry-on luggage' refer to?
options: A small bag that passengers are allowed to bring into the aircraft cabin

questions.question: In travel terminology, what is 'jet lag'?
options: A temporary sleep disorder caused by traveling across multiple time zones, disrupting the body's internal clock

questions.question: At an airport, what is 'duty-free'?
options: A retail area where goods are sold without local or national taxes and duties

questions.question: What does 'terminal' mean in the context of an airport?
options: A building where passengers board and disembark from aircraft
The last flight of the day

questions.question: In air travel, what is a 'connecting flight'?
options: A flight that requires passengers to change planes at an intermediate airport to reach their destination
A flight that connects two countries

questions.question: What does 'tarmac' refer to at an airport?
options: The paved surface area where aircraft taxi, park, and are loaded

questions.question: In travel, what is an 'itinerary'?
options: A detailed plan or schedule for a journey, including dates, destinations, and activities

questions.question: What does 'turbulence' refer to in air travel?
options: Irregular atmospheric motion causing sudden, bumpy movement of the aircraft

questions.question: At an airport, what is the 'baggage carousel'?
options: A rotating conveyor belt in the arrivals area where passengers collect their checked bags

questions.question: In travel terminology, what does 'visa' refer to?
options: An official endorsement or permit in a passport allowing entry into a specific country

questions.question: What is an 'airline lounge' at an airport?
options: A private area offering comfortable seating, food, and drinks for premium or qualifying travelers
A waiting area for all passengers
